benchmark_details.name: FaST (Feature-aware Sampling and Tuning for Personalized Preference Alignment with Limited Data)
benchmark_details.overview: This paper introduces two new datasets—DnD and ELIP—for studying the problem of Personalized Preference Alignment with Limited Data (PPALLI) and benchmarks various alignment techniques.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To facilitate research in personalized preference alignment using limited data.

data.source: Two newly created datasets: DnD focusing on character preferences and ELIP focusing on conversational assistant preferences.
data.size: 1,290 preference tuples for DnD; 800 preference tuples for ELIP
data.annotation: Responses were annotated by users based on a preference questionnaire.

methodology.calculation: Metrics such as accuracy of preferred response prediction and qualitative evaluation based on LLM-judges.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores denote better alignment with user preferences.
methodology.validation: Datasets were validated using multiple random train/validation/test splits.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: The datasets and models respect user data by allowing personal preference data to remain on users' devices.
